casebody.data:
WILKES
v.
CITY OF GREENVILLE. No. 368PA15-1. Supreme Court of North Carolina. May 20, 2016. Anita B. Hunt, Durham, for Wilkes, Johnnie. Matthew P. Blake, Cary, for City of Greenville, et al. J. William Crone, IV, for N.C. Association of Self-Insurers, et al. J. Timothy Wilson, for N.C. Association of Self-Insurers, et al. Bruce A. Hamilton, Raleigh, for N.C. Association of Self-Insurers, et al. Tracey L. Jones, Raleigh, for N.C. Association of Self-Insurers, et al. Allison B. Schafer, Legal Counsel/Director of Policy, for N.C. Association of Self-Insurers, et al. Christine Teresa Scheef, for N.C. Association of Self-Insurers, et al. Kimberly S. Hibbard, General Counsel, for N.C. Association of Self-Insurers, et al. M. Duane Jones, Charlotte, for N.C. Association of Defense Attorneys, et al. Angela Farag Craddock, Raleigh, for N.C. Association of Defense Attorneys, et al.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 18th of May 2016 by Employers Coalition of North Carolina, Property Casualty Insurers Association of America, and American Insurance Association for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 20th of May 2016."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
